intro: Sarcanthus macphersonii, commonly known as the Macpherson's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact growth habit with succulent-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
